args:
It turns out Nedrick's goal is to grant the power
of shapeshifting to the entire world. But when
Zethia and Ilia make to stop his mad scheme,
Phares and Beren show up and attempt to
control the Holywyrm with black mana.
I will not permit you to make a pact with\nBahamut, Nedrick! Not ever!
(If what Ilia said is true, then I must stop\nNedrick here and now.)
You! What are you doing here?!
Heya, Zethia! It's been a whileâ€”\na thousand years, if I'm not mistaken.
Yeah, so I know me and Mordecai threw\nourselves into the otherworld when we\nsealed up the Other a thousand years ago.
Anyway, a lot of stuff went down, but the\nend result of all that is that me and\nMordecai are very much alive and kicking.
Sadly, we don't have time for a huggy\nreunion right now. We've gotta stop\nNedrick, and fast.
What do you mean? And how can you even\nknow about Nedrick?
Seriously, no time for any of that.\nI'll try to tell you when it's all over.
All that matters right now is this:\nYou are the only one who can stop him.
Why are you interfering with me?\nWhat have you learned?
She told me what you're planning.
I don't know who you are, but I see by\nyour clothing that you come from the past.
Darn straight! I'm Ilia, and I came here\nfrom a thousand years ago.
We can do the full introductions later.\nRight now, we need to focus on you,\nNedrick.
I think there's something you neglected\nto mention to the group.
You want to get yourself a Dawnshard and\nreforge your pact with Bahamut.
And after that, you plan to give the power\nof shapeshifting to every single person in\nthe entire world. ...How close am I?
You mean to give it to EVERYONE?!
Almost anything is possible if one has a\nfull-fledged pact with Bahamut.
Yet I'd be very curious to know why THAT\nis the thing you've decided to pursue.
...Until this moment, choice has been the\nprivilege of the strong in our world.
People who lack strength lack any kind of\nagency. I know this well, for I was once\nthe same.
So I intend to give all the power of\nshapeshifting that has so long been\nclaimed by the Alberian royal family.
People will gain great strength from this,\nbut that is not all.
They will gain wings! They will have the\nfreedom to choose and act as they wish\nwithout anyone holding them on a leash!
What I seek is nothing less than a just\nway for people to exist. A new ideal.
So you're just not gonna mention the huge\nflaw in that little plan of yours?
Uh oh. This can't be good.

Even those in whom dragonblood flows
are not granted the boon of shapeshifting
unless they successfully complete the
Dragon Choosing.
Individuals are tested by the Choosing\nto determine if they possess the necessary\nphysical and mental fortitude.
It forms a system in which only those\nworthy of shapeshifting are able to gain\nthat great power.
If you grant the power to all, uncountable\nnumbers of them will prove unable to\nwithstand the process.
Once they shapeshift, they will be utterly\nconsumed by the power and rendered\nunable to regain their normal form.
I suspect they'll end up as something\nthat's neither human nor dragon.\nSomething...horrible.
Gyaaa! That's even worse than I thought!

Okay, bub, listen up! You can claim all you
want that you're doing this for the sake of
the weak, but what you're offering them
isn't freedom at all!
Yet some will gain strength and be saved.
And how does that result in a world\ndifferent from ours if only the strong\nare able to survive in it?

Exactly. Nedrick, I understand why you
want to do this, but there has to be a
better wayâ€”one that doesn't require
such a brute-force approach.

Can YOU save this world, then? Can you
save all of the weakâ€”those who have no
choice but to accept their persecution?
If so, how? And when?
Sacrifice is necessary to see an ideal\nmade real. Pretty words and deeds sound\nsweet, but in the end save nothing.
Your ï¼‚justiceï¼‚ is empty. There's no resolve\nbehind it. No ideal beating at its heart.
It is words on the wind, and nothing more.\nIt is hollowâ€”as are you.
Oh, come on! We already took you out!
Wait. Is that black mana surrounding him?
He's in pain... Oh, this is horrible!
You and your merry little band have given\nus a method to seize control of Elysium.
You would seek to control even the\nHolywyrm with your vile mana?!
Yes, and what dragon could be more worthy\nof the effort? Isn't that right, Beren?
Yeah. I think it'll be a bit of a challenge,\nbut I'll do my best.
Everyone, we need to back off for now!\nMake sure you protect yourselves!
These fiends must be going wild because\nof the black mana.
B-but we can barely stand! How are we \nsupposed to face off against fiends?
The how doesn't matter. We simply must.
At long last, the time has come. From this\nmoment forth, history will be changed,\nalong with the very world!
No! He's going to remake EVERYTHING!
